text:
Good craft lager one I could drink time after time. Harvieston is one of my favourite brewery's. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle. A clear pale golden beer with a huge most good lasting white head. Mild citrusy hoppy aroma, hints of grainy malt, dry malty. Taste of mild citrusy hops, citrons, pale malt, mild bitterness, overall boring but good drinkable.

F: medium size, white, quick gone.
C: pale gold, clear.
A: malty, grassy, floral, light caramel, bread.
T: malty, grassy, light fruity, bready, floral, caramel, light to medium body, medium carbonation, sweet but in good interesting way, enjoyed, 33cl bottle from Waitrose supermarket @ Albion Way in Horsham.
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts citrus spicy water and hops flavor malts citrus spicy and bitter hops
Can from Martins fairview. Pours amber straw gold with white head. Honey, bread mild citrus flavor. Nice for style.
Dedent lager. Sweet honey taste that lingers on. Not too fizzy. Good beer in the right settings.

Clear , golden color. One finger thick , white head. Aroma of grass , hay and malt . Malty taste with mild bitterness. Decent lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl Bottle @ 2D2Dspuma Tienda, Barcelona, Spain.
Pale golden colour with white head.
Aroma is malt, biscuit, yeast, herbs.
Taste is malt, grain, sweet, pine, slightly hoppy.
Medium body, average carbonation.

In a mystery case from beer hawk. Crisp IPA (not lager as described? ), pours light golden with no head. Light medium hoppy. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

8/20 a lager but it's got good flavour, a slight step up from corona, bud etc

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear lemon yellow with no head. Very little aroma, but its slightly fresh. A very nice classic lager. Smooth and nicely bodied.

Pours pale yellow, clear. Thin film on top, no head to speak of. Smells like mowed grass, but not nice tidy lawn grass---this is like mowing a field of weeds. Also a hint of something tarry, like asphalt. Really odd aroma. Medium body. Oily. Little bit of citrus at the end.

Bottle from Waitrose - legacy rating.

Pours clear, pale golden with a thin frothy white head. Aroma grass, hay, clementine and rather malty. Soft carbonation and watery finish.
Good all round lager with sweet, slightly honey taste. Is often on special at my local supermarket.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 500ml bottle. Pours a clear amber with a small white head. Nose is slightly sweet floral, honey, lemon, grassy with some sweet grapefruit. Medium mouth feel for a lager, with a moderate carbonation to push the taste around the mouth. Taste is bready malt, grassy and a citrus lemon leading into a slight resin hop finish. There is a touch of honey and grapefruit sweet taste in there too. Lovely stuff.

330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with a small white head. Aroma: hops, slight floral/herb, pale malt. Taste: hops, light bittering/metallic notes, light floral, herbs. Smooth, medium bodied, medium carbonation. Not a favourite but a very good lager.

Bottle at home. Pours pale gold, frothy head. Aroma of toast and something slightly musty. Crisp and slightly bitter with a sweeter finish. Been around a long time and its a good if hardly groundbreaking lager.
Keg. Pours pale gold. Light hop aroma with touch of lemon and flowers. Light and crisp with mild fruity bitterness. Probably the best British larger out there.
330ml bottle at Bills, Durham. Pale carbonated gold with a fine white head. Slightly metallic and crisp lager aroma. Somewhat watery on the palate, with grainy notes offset by slight sweetcorn.
Keg at the Faraday, Epsom. Pours pale golden with a white head. Aroma of herbs and malt. Bitter finish.

Helder goudgeel bier met een romige witte schuimkraag. 
Aroma van mout (enigszins biscuit) en hop bitter. 
Smaak is net als het aroma. 
Licht mondgevoel met licht koolzuur en een licht droge afdronk.
Bottle at home in the garden, 19th July 2016. Pours clear, dark amber. Aroma is yeast, hops. Taste is clean, hops come through, its highly drinkable, a hoppy style lager. Good

HOME 17062016 (33 cl bottle): A brilliant yellow coloured beer with a good creamy white head. Aroma of malt (somewhat biscuit) and hop bitter. Taste is like the aroma. A nice lager, but not too fresh, because of the somewhat malty taste. Palate is somewhat sticky, grain malt and light dry bitter.

Has a good sour and umami aroma, unique for a lager and appetizing. No head, but an okay gold body. Good lager flavours, again nothing to distinguish but quite refreshing. Crisp finish. This is a fine lager, highly drinkable.

Bottle from Morrison's, Fort William 160622.
Medium golden clear amber, firm creamy white head. Malty nose. Nice crisp bitter resins with herbal notes but no citrus. Excellent lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: herbs and some pine.
Appearance: golden color and white head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, pine, flowers, heather, some malty backbone.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, herbal.
Overall: Flowers and herbs, thats all.
500ml bottle. Again, lager is not my favourite style of beer, but this is a good example of the genre. Miles better than mass market dishwater like Carling, Fosters, Cobra etc.

En tør humlet lagerøl lavet med pilsnermalt. Den er ikke humlet man bliver helt hvid om munden bagefter, men god frisk smag. Den har et lavt kulsyre indhold, måske for at rigtige ale-drikkere også vil synes om den.
From bottle at Bills Glasgow. Colour is clear gold. Aromas of wheat, bread and yeast. Taste gives more light malts.
Draft. Pours a golden yellow color. Aroma and taste are grains and some citrus.
Small white head with a golden clear colour. Malty, doughy, grassy aroma. Taste is sweet with a slightly hoppy/bitter finish. Main taste is melon and grapefruit.
Bottle; pours clear gold with a white head; aroma of malt, grass, with a touch of citrus; taste is bittersweet with malt and some grass; finish is bitter with a little citrus; meh
Butelka 330ml. Zlota barwa klarowne piana biala obfita.w zapachu ciekawa goryczka chmielowa. W smaku swietnie dobrany chmiel goryczka na finiszu.dobry lager

Lovely golden appearance. Looks like a lovely dark white wine! Decent lagerish aroma. If you like lagers. A little bit hoppy and fresh and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft sample at the Great British Weekend New Edition 2015 Belgrade Serbia.11.09.2015.Pour it clear golden color with small white head.Aroma grassy.Taste quite malty, fruit sweet finish.Ok balanced.

clear golden colour, moderate sized head; aroma of grains, grassy and floral notes, vegetable, fruitiness, nuts and some biscuit; taste of biscuit, bread, fruity notes, nuts, hints of honey and hoppy bitterness in the background of the malty body; this is, what a lager should provide to deserve the "premium lager" category! surprisingly good!

In bottiglia. Colore giallo dorato, limpida, schiuma fine, non molto abbondante nè persistente. Aroma di cereale, fieno, miele millefiori, crosta di pane. corpo leggero, pulito e croccante. al palato ritroviamo miele e cereale con finale di fieno e erba appena tagliata non troppo intensi ma che bilanciano a dovere la birra. carbonazione media

Backlog rating. Keg at Mother Kellys, London. It pours a clean golden color with medium white head. Aroma is light grass, some citrus, medium grains ans light starch. taste has light lemon, light caramel, heavy grains and some grass. Light bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, decent lager
Helder goud. Tja, na alle ola dubhs is dit natuurlijk niet geweldig. Maar ja, de rest was op. Later nog maar eens reraten want het smaakt nu nergens naar.

(Harviestoun Schiehallion (Bottle/Keg)) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a glass tankard, ABV 4.8%
Golden yellow colour on the body, a bit cloudy, small and thin white head on top, with average retention, and lazy activity in the glass.
Aroma has grains, earth notes, faint citrus.
Taste is nicely bitter, with good hop presence, citrus, grains,earth, milky notes.
Medium body, soft carbonation.
Nicely hopped lager.

330ml bottle, 4.8% BB Feb 2017. Orange, clear, lightly sparkling, small foamy white head. Aroma is a little papery and metallic but theres demerara sugar and pithy citrus in there too. Body is medium, spritzy carbonation, just slightly foamy. Taste is semisweet, straw and some thin syrup, nice crisp finish, dry but not really bitter. Pleasant lager. You could drink tonnes of this without noticing.

330 ml. bottle. Purchased @Malt Attacks. BBF 12/2016. Back of the label actually calls this the Champagne of Lagers. Hazy apple / stereotypical golden, small solid white head. Nose is vegetable, vegetable & floral bitter, weeds, the main note is vegetable, light white pepper. Taste is lightly milky, touch butter, vegetable bitter, weeds, floral, light grass, milky cooked vegetable / cabbage quality, some wet paper, There are definitely some hops here. Some milky creamy character. Too vegetable & vegetable bitter for me. I sort of hoped for me. Step above your average pale lager, that isnt much of a compliment I suppose.

Pours a clear golden yellow with a pillowy top. The smell is grain, grass...smells crisp and clean. The taste is grain and grass...some bitterness in the middle lingering and combining with dryness on the end. Light+ in body with fine, active carbonation. I think it will go well with the burritos on my plat!
On Tap. Nice grassy aroma, bitter small, but well-hop feel. Pleasant refreshing in hot weather.
Not into this at all. Its way to bitter on the palate. Trying too hard to impress and leaves a twisted tang on the middle of the tongue and roof of the mouth. 5.5/10.

Estava ansioso em prová-la já que é considerada por alguns como uma das melhores lager do mundo. O aroma é maltado e gostoso bem acima do padrão do estilo. Já o sabor, apesar de ser acima da média, não tem nada de excepcional. O ponto forte é a harmonia. Amargor na medida e é bem refrescante. Minha expectativa foi em excesso. Também não se pode esperar muita complexidade de uma lager. 
É uma boa breja que cumpre bem o seu papel

Bottle from Cambridge Wine Merchants (Kings Parade). Dark deep yellow, quite fizzy with a loose white head. Aroma of grass and lemon, some tangerine, the tiniest hint of astringency. It has an excellent taste, however: sweet and refreshing with a bitter/herbal balancing note. The bitterness is more obvious in the finish. Orange peel in the finish and aftertaste. Nice.

Bottle from Booths, Media City. Pale golden with a very light carbonation and next to no head. Has a very floral nose thats not overly pleasant. Some lager malt is evident whilst retaining an ale-like texture.

Coloração palha,límpida,espuma com baixa formação e duração,aroma maltado com cítrico ao fundo,sabor refrescante,balanceado,com boa dose de lúpulo em sintonia com malte e fermento,dando um "amarguinho" delicioso,final seco levemente amargo,ótima "drinkability". Lager simples,bem feita e deliciosa.

Bottle 33cl. Clear medium gold, small frothy white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; aroma malts, grain, floral hops, soap; taste medium bitter, moderate sweet, grainy; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, fresh dry bitter finish, still a bit grainy; decent lager.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear golden with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are grains, malt, and flowers - with a dry finish.

330ml . drank from a tumbler . chalky , spicy ,malty nose . zero head above a piss after a year infection colour . I like a nice easy to drink soulless pale lager ,but this  shit is shit. it tastes of nothing and looks like ass.

On tap at Gollem Amstelstraat. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma is quite malty and bready, wort, hint of peas, light fruity hops. Flavour is malty, light bready, decent grassy and light citrusy bitter finish. Light bodied. OK lager.
Bottle box headingley. Drunk from bottle pale malt aroma taste same decent hoppy bitter. Ok carbonation good lager.
bottle from beer hawk a nice beer not a great fan of lagers but thought i would give it a go nice hop aroma pale orange in colour dry bitter finish

From a bottle in Edinburgh.

Bright golden body with medium carbonation. Crisp light body. 
Modestly stronger flavor than average for style, mostly due to the hops.

330 ml bottle into schooner glass. Fruity nose, a touch of hops. Pale amber beer with small lasting white head. Medium carbonation. Smooth in the mouth with delicate fruit notes then strong bitterness to finish. Quite abrupt. Excellent lager.
Keg at the Queens Head. Slightly grainy malty flavour with a herbal spiciness. Mild bitterness. Crisp dry finish.
1.8.2014. Clear golden. Quite watery, some malts, grainy, toffee and bitterness.
From a bottle. Mild peppery malt finish is interesting, minimal head and a faint aroma biscuit. Not too bad.
330ml bottle,pours clear gold with a light fluffy white head. Grainy malt, light caramel, light floral, balanced light bitter finish. Decent lager.
Poured medium amber with an off white head. Aroma of sweet berries and nuts. Light to medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter in the aftertaste.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 Aroma of malt, grains, grassy notes. Flavour is light sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Okay Lager.

330ml bottle @home. 13-03-2015.
BBD: Jan 2015.
In short: average lager.
Pours clear deep gold with white head. Short head retention, poor lacing. Cooked vegetables aromas. Light body, average carboantion, crispy texture. Taste is malty, herbal, some off flavours.
Bottle at Handmade Burger Co, Birmingham. Looks headless and fizzy, like sparkling apple juice. Bitter bready malt but a short finish, lacking depth.

Light perfume aroma with hints of bubblegum, clear golden colour with a small diminishing head, good balance of malts and hops, cerials grains leaving a light bitter aftertaste, refreshing medium bodied session lager

helder gouden met minimale witte kraag. aroma van graan...héél véél graan en veel mout. smaken zijn matig zoet, redelijk bitter, sterk, matig fruitig, sterk moutig en granige smaak, medium body, nee vind dit denk ik één van de mindere bieren van deze brouwer
Bottle from tesco. Rapidly dissipating head. Light clear golden appearance. Wins on taste.
Cask. Pours golden with a perfect head. Hints of citrus and medium malt. Finishes a bit sour. Great.
Aroma di pane e frutta matura. Limpida colore oro carico. Schiuma candida abbastanza persistente con qualche merletto. In bocca mi ricorda una marzen palato vellutato

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a clear straw colour with a frothy white head and a few bubbles. The aroma is malt, light hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a light stale malt hop bitter palate.
Moderate to light bodied with average carbonation. Craft lager? Its just a slightly malty lager at the end of the day!
Clear yellow body with a medium white head. Aroma is malty, fruity, some citrus. Taste is sweet and medium bitter. Really nice refreshing finish.
33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Clear gold color. Thin to medium white head. Smooth body. Taste is light bitter, light sweet. Aroma is light hop, fruit, cereal, pinneaple. Nice aroma!

33cl bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice bitterness with some sweet tones. Grassy hops, some tropical fruits, straw and yeast. A nice refreshing brew.
bottle, Waitrose Sidford. Golden yellow with a dense white head. Malty base with some honey, grassy hops in the finish, with a citrusy touch.
Overall: Sweet, apples, butter, grass, peel.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2014-12-20.

Draught @ Wildeman, Amsterdam.
Dark clear yellow, fine white head. Hard candy nose. Tad sweet, malty. No bitter that I spotted...

Appearance: Clear golden with almost no head.
Aroma: Flowery hops. 
Taste: Nice bitter. 
Palate: Refreshing, light bodied. with lasting bitter. 
Overall: Nice.

How: Bottle.
Where: Tayer and Jones with the Twist, Stockholm.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, grass, hops.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, grass, hops, some malt.

Golden body and fairly stable yet creamy head. Corny, Czech hops, refined. Not entirely convinced. Taste is better. Much better even, with great bitterness and full flavoured malts. Very quaffable! Great brew although the aroma is too straightforward for me as a beer nerd. I can see this winning over the beer curious pilsner drinker though! (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)
Clear and golden lager. Grassy hop taste. Medium bitterness. This one is very easy to drink.
Bottle 33 cl @ Masala Zone, London. A lager with nice hints of citrus and herbs. Would choose it again.

33 cL bottle at home. Pours clear golden with a medium white head leaving pretty nice lacing. Aroma has some hay, grassy hops and some flowery notes. Taste has some grassy hops and a medium bitterness. Pretty nicely hopped and crisp. Medium body and carbo. Nice one.
Pours pale straw with light head which dissipates quickly. Floral aroma and malty taste. Light hopping and good balance. Ill taste this again.
Nice and crisp. Floral and hoppy. Small short lasting white head. A lager but better than all the usual ones.
Bottle. Pours slightly cloudy clear golden with short lasting white head. Aroma is malt, grassy hops, honey, hint of yeast. Taste is malt, honey, hops, grassy aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours clear, golden, with a white head that disappates quickly. Medium bodied, low carbonation, very fine bubbles. Aroma is citrus, floral hops and slight grass. Taste is grainy, grapefruit and herbs. Palate is moist with some body. Finish is moist and grassy.
Golden yellow colour with quickly vanishing white head. Light malty aroma. Taste is malty, citrus fruit and slightly bitter.

Bottle. Waitrose. Clear gold. Untidy, white head. Sweet, lager malt. Some spicy biscuit. Taste has an initial sweetness. Turns dry, and light, leafy bitter. Some body to the palate. Finishes metallic bitter.
Hazy gold,fast fading white head. Salty spicy nose. Bland start,fatty malt mid, lasting spicy hop finish
Outstanding!!!!!! Earthy, leaves, alcohol, bread, caramel, chocolate, roasty, resin, floral

From tap at Mother Kellys Bethnal Green. Pours golden with white head. Aroma is malty, some grass, citrus. Taste is light to medium sweet and bitter, grainy, malt, hints of citrus. Aftertaste is slightly bitter, medium carbonation. Easy going beer.
On tap at Dog Street, light amber color and a nice mouth and some malts, nothing special
Nice lager beer. Really tasty and refreshing at the same time. Wat you want for a lager beer but you dont find many times.
Poured from 330mL bottle. Clear, pale yellow with minimal white head. Subtle citrus and mild hops with a smooth fruity sweetness. Finally a lager I dont mind!

White weak head. Deep golden colour. Aroma is malty with grainy and light herbal notes. Flavor is malty too with grainy and biscuits tones, slightly herbal, ending in a moderately hoppy with a hint of biscuits finish. Light bodied.
Crystal clear with a small white head. Sweet aroma, floral hops. Sweet grainy taste, little hops, lacks a little bitterness. Overall ok.
Lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av lys malt og gress. Smak av lys malt, sitrus og humle. VP Kvadrat.
Litt søtlig duft av humle og malt. Dunkel lys gulbrun farge. Tynt lag skum, ring langs kant. Søtlig smak av humle, malt og noe appelsin.
malty and citric aroma... the taste is well-balanced, malty, with notes of herbs and buckwheat... bright hoppy bitterness... aftertaste is bitter and rather dry...

Aroma: Malt: Medium malty sweetness, bread crust. Hops: Medium, fruity, floral, light spice
Appearance: Body: Clear light gold. Head: Small, off-white, good retention. Lacing.
Flavour: Medium-high bitterness. Medium sweetness. Malt: Medium, cracker. Hops: Medium-high, fruity, pear, slight spice. Well balanced. Crisp, dry finish. Lingering bitterness, not harsh. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body, high carbonation.
Overall: Very nice beer. Easy drinking. Enjoyable. Flavourfull.

330 ml bottle, poured. 
23. Specialty Beer: 
2A. German Pilsner (Pils) with non-noble hops
Bottle @ home. Aroma is caramel malts, fruity hops, light herbal/forest notes. Flavour is light bitter hops, slight herbal and fruity notes. Light malt and bready notes. Decent.
Bottle @ Voldby. Pours golden white a small pale head. Nose and taste is light bitter with grassy notes and malty sweetness.

Slight fruity taste of malt, grain. Medium body. Light bitter finish.
Bottle: Poured a copper orange with a fluffy off white head. Aroma was very bubblegum, perfume, and malt. Taste is strong malty backbone with some metallic hops, and grain.
Pours flat and golden. Sweet, grassy, pretty bland. Wow, had this many times on tap, always liked it, hoppy and crisp. This is shit though.

Butelka 0.33L. 
Wygląd: Klarowne, jasnozłote z iskrą. Piana bujna, biała, drobnopęcherzykowa, lekko strzela i opada w umiarkowanym tempie, delikatnie znacząc szkło.
Aromat: intensywny słodowy, jęczmień, miód, do tego cytryna i owoce tropikalne i nuty kwiatowe od chmielu.
Smak: słodowy, cytrunowy z niską do średniej goryczką. Finisz lekko za suchy, ściągający.
Odczucie: ciało niskie, wysycenie powyżej średniego, faktura jak nieoszlifowana deska.

Jak na jasnego lagera to OK, zdecydowanie ciekawsze niż "koncerniaki" ale szału nie ma.
Clear golden very little head. Quite sweet on the tongue. Aroma of honey and hops. Quite flat.

Flaske fra polet, delt med Ovesen på Holmen: kort skum, beskjeden aroma av blomster og litt honning. Det samme i smaken. Her har de vært tilbakeholdne med humlebruken. Craft lager?? Dog bedre enn standard industripils.
Clear golden. Not much head. Subdued aroma of flowers. Flowers continue into taste, with honey and hop bitterness. Best than a eurolager, but not very exciting.

Bottle from Waitrose, Berkhampsted. Poured a clear golden colour, with a halo of white head. Fairly light aroma, some grass, lager malt and honey. Chewy malt flavour, light grassy hop and rather mild overall. Finish was light citrus, resin and raisins.

Bottle from Yamaichi. Thought I had rated this long ago. Lemony, floral hops, rather like an English golden, some bready, honey malts. Medium gold with a low, fine head. Lemony, slightly biscuity. Simple and straightforward. Slight lager feel but not much. tingly, peppery hop finish. Easy drinking and enjoyable.

Molt bona lager, molt bon aroma i molt bon gust. És una cervesa que acompanya molt bé amb qualsevol tipus de menjar.
Muy buena lager, con un buen aroma y gusto. Es una cerveza que acompaña muy bien con cualquier comida.
500ml bottle form Tesco. Pours clear gold with a short-lived white head. Aromas of cereal, grains, hay, lemon. Taste has more of the same, light bitterness. Medium bodied, clean finish. Not bad.

Barwa: słomkowa, lekko zmętniona. Piana biała, drobno pęcherzykowa, niezbyt ofita, szybko opadająca. Wysycenie niskie. 

Aromat: słodowy, zbożowy, z akcentami chmielowymi (grejpfrut, owoce tropikalne, zioła). Nieco bardziej łagodny niż w Bitter & Twisted. Po chwili jednak wyczuwalne lekkie nuty utlenienia, obniżające wrażenie ogólne. 

Smak: słodowy, owocowy, całkiem rześki. Dość lekki, przypominający czeskie czy niemieckie piwa. Goryczka poniżej średniej.
330ml bottle from Waitrose. Pale gold with a fluffy white head. Nice lager some some hops in the aroma and flavour.

Bottle from Johns Market via Phil. Pours a slightly cloudy golden color, little to no head. Bread, citrus in nose, slight. Body soft, with a citric pie crust bitterness in the finish. Plenty enjoyable, would be better on draft?

500ml (I think) bottle. Moderate sticky head, blond colour, slightly hazy. Herbal hop aroma, apple lager malt. Hopsy for a lager, slight cardboard and grain. Crisp body. Overall, a very well made lager, much more flavourful than a macro lager.
500ml bottle at home - clear deep golden, thin off-white head with small bubbles, pale malty, yeasty aroma, no lacing, corn, mild yeast, very high carbonation, malty and metallic aftertaste

Pours golden and clear. Hoppy nose with a hint of caramel and sweet malts. An earl grey tea herbal/perfume going on with the palate with a passion fruit/lychee tartness. One of the best lagers in the market place.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 Bottle from Booths Ripon. Usual golden looks of a lager. Reasonably flavoursome for a lager, but still pretty bland to me. Refreshing, but unremarkable.

Bottle 33cl, a clear yellow beer with low head. Nose is cereal and malt and alcoholic like. Aroma is on light caramel, nutty, metallic, water, medium bitterness, finish is slightly fruity and honey hints.

Aontaíonn tú gan aon ábhar atá mídhleathach nó gráiniúil nó a sháraíonn aon chearta tríú páirtí a chur suas ná ceangal a dhéanamh leis. Aontaíonn tú gan aon ní a dhéanamh a chuirfidh isteach ar úsáideoirí eile leas a bhaint as an Suíomh nó a dfhéadfadh difear a dhéanamh doibriú nó do shlándáil an tSuímh. Aontaíonn tú gan iarracht a dhéanamh rochtain a fháil ar fhaisnéis phearsanta Úsáideoirí eile.
A very nice unusual lager. Very flowery but a great tasting beer with a complex flavour. A great cross over from an ale. Very nice out of the bottle served cold.
Tap at Draft House Battersea. Nothing mind blowing here but very nice and clean. Decent stuff for a lager

lager améliorée de couleur blonde, mousse légère, maltée, avec des notes citronnées, une touche florale et une très légère amertume. Texture assez sèche. Désaltérante, légère et facile à boire, mais manque de goût et de fruits.
Aroma destacado, com toques citricos marcantes. Sabor bem lupulado e floral , e forte, com personalidades .

Draft at whole foods Cheltenham. Pours hazy yellow colour with a small white head that disapeers quickly leaving a small white lacing. Aroma is lemon, grain, bready, slight orange and and ever so slightly herbal. Soft carbonation, medium mouthfeel. Taste has lemons, cracker, quite spritsy and dry. Subtle orange sweetness reminiscent of marmalade. Soft melon and lychee. Very enjoyable!
Bottle. Light pale blond colour, not much head. Aroma is citrus malty, wheat, lychee. Taste is alright, citrus, decent enough lager, good maltiness. Easy drinking. Its alright.

Gold pour with creamy white head and lace. Aroma is light sour lemon and some malt. Light malt flavor with a strong floral/citrus bitter. Medium body with smooth carbonation. On tap at McKays Hotel Pub

One of the better standard lagers I've had. Clear gold colour with a big white head which slowly fades away allowing for gentle aromas of stone fruit, citrus and a little bread dough. Bread dough and malt flavours dominate the front to mid palate making it relatively seeet, although there is some citrus coming through at the end to balance it out.
Boa cerveja...Aparência clean, espuma branca média!! Aroma gostoso e sabor crisp e refrescante no gole e final seco!!!

LCBF backlog. KEG.

Aroma: slightly sweet, flowery.

Taste: balanced sweet and hoppy.

hazy med straw yellow color, reasonable even whte head. medium strength hop aroma. hop flavor with a pale malt note, and a bit of a celery note. a faint citrus note. soft, round body. reasonable finishing bitterness. a crispness to it.

500 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits. Pours a clear golden colour with modest-sized head. Aroma is honeyed grains and herbal bitterness. Flavour is biscuit, honey, some fruitiness and a sharp herbal character. Average body. Decent lager.
Crisp malt aroma. Clear golden pour with a thin white lace. Malt flavour with a sweet honey background. Tangy finish.

Bottle from Asahiya. Caramel, grass, and some prunes, also pineapple and strained peaches. Medium straw color. Mild fruity sweetness in initial / hops pop out in mid / finish is rich and balanced. Thin body. A lot more flavor than the average lager, to be sure. The wheat is apparent in the aroma, and maybe a little in the flavor. Good hoping. Very pleasant lager.

Strong herbal aroma, an introduction to the beer flavor. Strong and well hopped is an optimal choice for harmonization since it has markee taste. The beggining is slightly malty flavor, but is soon overpowered by dense hops with herbal flavors. Has a dry and short end.

500ml bottle, Dunnes Stores. Brilliant gold, clear, big white head which settles quickly enough. Big fruity, floral nose with peach, grass, hay and citrus. Flavour reprises the peachy fruity aroma, backed by sweet biscuit and a good dose of pine bitterness. Decent body, medium soft carbonation. Finish is really well balanced between dry, slightly sweet malt and moderate hop bitterness. Nice to get such a high quality beer this fresh too.

Bottle.

Head is initially small, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing.
Body is medium to dark yellow.

Aroma is moderately malty (biscuit, toasted bread), lightly hoppy (herbs, flowers), lightly yeasty (dough), with light notes of dried apricot and butter.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter, slightly husky.

Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Rather sweet and malty, and slightly buttery and husky...overall a rather clumsy, generic example but its ok.

Creamy lager with subtle carbonation lines. Noteable head which sashays its way down the glass neatly. Subtly hoppy nose, milky yeast edge. Decent swell of carbonation in a smooth, head scratching engulfment of what youd assume for a few seconds is a CO2 boosted golden ale. Creamy biscuit malt thread creeps in, on par with the cask version, before dumping the linger in a lager bunker. This weird palate sapping pasteurised finish doesnt totally spoil things, but Ive drank this for nearly ten years in many forms. They must have got something right to port it to keg - especially with the awkwardly marketable name. A worthy milestone rate for that alone.
Keg, The Granary, Edinburgh

500ml bottle - Golden yellow body, with a thick white head. Pleasant aroma of toasted malt, floral, light spice, grass, melons and citrus. The taste is biscuit, floral, lemon, hay and grass, with a light citric-bitter (almost grapefruit) finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Nice. Be interested to see if this is the best Premium Lager Ive rated.
Clear golden yellow with small white foam head. Aroma is weak bitter hoppy, little citrus taste is nice bitter, longer lasting bitter aftertaste. (Velp 201303)

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2013 A very dry tasting lager and a very refreshing one. Slightly more viscous than most with an underlying light biscuity, fruity sweetness. Citrusy hops complete this well balanced brew. The best lager I have ever tasted. 

Second rating.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090926.
Pours clear copper color with a medium head. Aroma of hops, fruits, caramel and grass. Flavor of fruits, caramel malts and hay.

500ml bottle. Pours clear amber with a good head. Looks great in the glass. Mild hops and slightly metallic aroma. Light sweetness offset by a good amount of bitterness for a lager. This is probably closer to what youd expect from a very light pale ale than a lager. The finish is more bitter and lasts longer and the hops shine through more. Far, far better than any macro lager (continental or otherwise) that I know.
500ml bottle- A good premium lager. A nice initial malt taste with a good hop bitter finish.

Poured a cloudy pale golden amber colour with a thin bubbly head that left little lace. Moderate carbonation. Aroma of sweet malt, but only faintly and a trace of floral hops. Taste initially malt sweetness followed by a reasonably pleasant hop bitterness in the aftertaste  quite hoppy, more like a pale ale. Light body. Finishes with pleasant bitterness as well as subtle malt sweetness. Certainly not a typical lager.

[keg, the Harviestoun Brewery Tap, Alva] Served on keg at their newly-constructed visitor bar at the brewery. Clear golden pour, voluminous white head. Aroma of citrus, grass and hay. Taste is very nice, well balanced, with the bitter, citrus flavours starting and being replaced by more biscuity mellowness. Aftertaste is long and dry. Ive thought for a while this could be the best Scottish lager  on this evidence, thats a definite. Supremely easy to drink, does the job in every case [01022013]

500. Pours a cloudy toffeeish pale amber with gold highlights. Dense creamy white head that falls quickly to suds. Loose drippy lace. Sharply vegetal nose. Caramel and butterscotch under. Creamy medium body, a little slick, with soft carb. Caramel, butter, and artichokes on the mid palate. Artichokey finish.

Bottle that pours a clear gold with a white foam head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma a flowery hoppiness. Taste hops, pleasant metallic dry clean and fruity with a clear bitter finish. Lager yeast and Id see its appeal.
Poured golden from tap at London hearthrow.  Very creamy white head. Has a bitter bite to it.  Dry pallet. Hints of floral, earthy, slightly malty. Pretty good

An absolutely gorgeous lager. Appearance wise, it has a nice colour, but nothing out of the ordinary. It has a lovely light citrusy aroma to it, which is backed up by a pleasant, light citrus taste. At the same time, it has a rich palate that explodes with flavour on your tongue. Its a beautiful beer to drink, packed full of flavour and easy to drink.
user_location: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, ENGLAND

text:
Pours amber with a small head.
Nose shows herbal and spicy hops, some resinous notes and bready malt.
Flavours include mroe bready malt and spicy, earthy and herbal hops.
Light body.
Good quaffer.

Draught at the Diamond BK.  Golden with some lace. The aroma is super thin with only a little fruit and citrus and grain coming through.  The flavor is quite a bit more amplified with these expressed very cleanly with a great strong hop bitterness, even a bit if funk.  Straightforward palate  awesome lager and somehow the hop fix i was looking for.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours Golden typical pilsner. Nose is a very IPA-like with lots of grapefruit and pine. Foam is small white bubbles. Taste is also IPA-like with a grapefruit and dryness. Theres something almost artificial in the combination of hops which is not unpleasant but also not very lagerlike. Finish is pleasant with a long lingering of hops. Body is light to medium. Decent, but not very exciting.

Tap at the Crown Rivers (JDW) LHR T5 - 03/11/12.
Clear pale golden, thin off white head which soon clears to a small pond and the edge of the glass. Looks pretty lifeless.
Light citrus on the nose, caramel malt and a touch of herbs.
Tastes of caramel malts, a little grass, touch of citrus.
Medium bodied with light spritzy carbonation leading to a bitter finish.
If all bars replaced crappy macro lagers with offerings like this then non beer centric bars would be a better place, however not a patch on the cask version!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
50cl bottle, BB 02/2014.
Dorée, col blanc épais.
Arôme est houblonné bien fleuri et frais rappelant les pissenlit, malt dans le style très anglais.
Palais est agréablement houblonné et fleuri laissant une amertume légère dans le style anglais ici avec le côté Goldings/Challenger pour ce côté frais agrumes.
Légère se terminant sur une petite pointe biscuité.

Pours clear. Good size head. Little aroma. Nice mouthfeel, good lacing. Taste is crips, with a little bitterness.
Not normally a lager drinker, but I enjoyed it.

Clear pale thin light goldish orange with a white soapy thin lacy lasting head. Smells stale, with light hops, citrus, flowery and malt. Medium to full thin body. Tastes of sweet grape, light chewy malt, hay with a soft hop bitter finish. More complex than it seems. With some melon and a bit of corn. Decent and interesting.
Hazy gold,fast fading white head. Salty spicy nose. Bland start,fatty malt mid, lasting spicy hop finish
Nice smooth taste. Fresh. Was quite surprised by the lovely taste. Would definitely have another.
Bottle 50 cl. Pours hazy golden in color with thin white head. Bready malts, floral hops and some hay in aroma. Hops, some sweet honey, hay and yeast in flavour.
Bottle 50 cl. Yellow, hazy with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, hops and citrus. Light bitter taste with a hoppy end. 17.08.2012

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Nice fruity aromas- light hoppy notes
Light body & light/ medium complexity .
Good bitterness, well balanced
Very enjoyable
Bottle at brewfellas. Golden staw color. Slight bitterness, wonderfully refreshing. For what this is it is top in its range.

50cl bottle shared with Joes and Dutchdrebus. Clear golden color, small to medium sized white head that disappears fairly quickly. Smell malts, slightly sweet and hops. Taste malts, hops, some bitter. Very fresh and easy drinkable. Medium carbonation, medium body.
Bottle thx to benzai. Pale yellow colour, small white head. Smells hoppy, bit fruity, malts. Tastes sweet, fruity, malty. Thinnish body, low carbo.
Bottle. Golden, white head. Nose is straw, hay, earth, grass, lemon. Taste is straw, grass, light citrus fruits, sweet corn. Dry bitter finish.
2012 - 09 - 04  500ml bottle. yellow golden colour. medium, fading, white head.herbal hops in aroma. medium bitter taste.

Panama City Beach, Fl - Chans Wine World - 500 ml bottle. Pours a sparkling medium golden with a tight white head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma has some grainy accents, a hint of olive oil, some grassy notes. Flavor is full and crisp. Pick up some nutty notes, some graininess, a bit of toasted bread. Crisp, clean mouthfeel. Nice sturdy lager.
Nice try from Harviestoun and as they never fail their lager is good too. nothing much to say
Bottle. Clear golden pour. Aroma of fruits, grainy, some crispy hops and slightly soapy. Flavor is grainy, slightly above average hopped lager, decent bitterness. Still a bit boring.

Good medium strong aroma is slightly caramellish, nuts, bread. Fruityness in background, fresh. Clear golden, long creamy head. Taste is bit dry and bitter with bitter finish, soft feel, light carbonation, medium body. Good one.
Malty, citric smell. Golden colour, white head. Malty and rubbery aroma, some sugar as well. Stinging palate, flat carbon. Also somewhat.. Burnt.

Clear golden amber, rim head and light lines of lace.  Taste is sweet caramel that grows into citrus and a touch of bubblegum, finishing with a light florel hop bitter.  Well-balanced, excellent example of the style.

On draft, not cask.  Clear golden pour with a thin head that hung around.  Some lacing.  Mild aroma of grain and little bitterness.  Very easy drinking.  Not on cask but the mouth feels like it.  Taste has some grass.
Pale gold with a fluffy white head. Herbal and honey nose, medium carbonation, light bodied, dry, slightly bitter finish.

Bottle. Golden, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light fruitiness and some grassy - herbal hoppyness. Body is light to moderate, malty and dryish flavor, light fruitiness and some grassy hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dry, grassy and herbal hoppyness. Dry lager with nice bitterness and no gimmicks.

Bottle. Pours dark yellow, with a finger thick head. Aroma has a nice pilsner-ish whiff, with zesty hops, caramel malts, toffee and some chocolate. Flavour is crispy, but sweet. Malty notes of biscuits, bread and caramel, with a very nice and ever-growing and ever-going orange peel hoppiness.
Pale golden straw colour, aroma is clean, a little hoppy and grainy. Taste is grassy, a little bitter, some fruits and very refreshing. A great lager.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden straw-colour with a medium off-white head. Aromas of pale malt, hay and a touch of spices. Interesting flavours of grains, grass and nice hops. Slick mouthfeel with a nice light bitterness. An easy-drinking tasteful and well-balanced premium lager. This beer really stands out among all boring premium lagers out there.

Pretty decent brew. Poured at a good temperature with a nice, foamy, frothy, off-white head that settles after a bit and a smidgen of lace. Color is a gold amber with lots of bubble trails. Aroma is fresh beer, malt, hop, a little fruit and spice. Flavors like nose, plus sweet in the front, bittler on top, tang on the sides; some grain and a little hop floral. Body and carbonation are excellent. Finish is like flavor, of average length and very easy drinking. Tasty, but a little pricey.

Golden, slightly cloudy pour with a small white head. Aromas of hops, barley, grass, grapefruit. Smooth, refreshing and full bodied. Decent carbonation with grapefruit, hint of vanilla, hops and barley well balanced on the palate.

Schiehallion is a really decent lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle from Alko

Pours clear golden yellow with a small head. Aroma of hay, floral hops and bready malts. Taste is malty and bready with some stingy German hops. Finish is malty and slightly metallic with some stingy hops and hay notes. Not a big fan of these kind of lagers.
Nice refreshing beer. Hoppy and a bit bitter, wish all premium lagers tasted like this one
Maintained a nice, foamy head for a decent amount of time though there isnt much scent to it. A nice, sharp bitter taste and a very refreshing beer.
bottle from Pangaea Bottle Shop, Sacramento. Pours clear golden with a modest off-white head and a toffee aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a dry yeasty finish. Refreshing and tasty.

Bottle. Golden with short lasting white head. Aroma has bready lager yeast, cereals with some caramel and fruity hops, slightly floral, white grapes. Taste is nice and light, some honey in there, some hops, little floral, white grapes, lager yeast, honey. Crisp and dry. This is at the upper end of the lager spectrum
Color is clear golden with medium foamy  head. Aroma is malts and hops. A bit sweet also. Flavor is sweet malts, citrus, hops and a bit bitter palate. Nice.
50 cl, bottled. Pours clear orange with a thin white head. Aroma: Malt, fruity hops. Taste: Mildly sweet, moderate bitterness. Pleasant. Subtle tones of herbs. Palate: Light-Medium bodied. Nice.

Bottle. Golden color, small white head. Malty aroma with notes of grain and hops. Taste is slightly sweet malt, grain, bitter, grassy and citrusy hops. Light-bodied, some bitterness in the aftertaste. Decent lager.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2015 Bottle at The Apiary. Clear golden body with a thin white head that slowly fades. Lively carbonation. Aroma of grain, biscuit and citrus. Flavour is earthy and nutty with a subtle under-ripe tropical fruit quality. Very clean and quaffable. Thin body with a light texture. Soft fizz. Probably my favourite widely available Lager.

Ha! I thought this was an ale-- it was to be our fourth stop on our golden ale tour of the world: proud old Scotland. But our tour has been derailed by a lager! Of well, it starts off looking the part anyway, bright yellow gold with a decent lasting white head. Aroma is pretty muted, clean grains and light tropical fruit notes, nothing too assertive. Flavours are clean cereal grains with tropical fruit hop character and a medium bitterness in the finish. Firmer mouthfeel, clean finish. A good lager, lending credence to Mike Myers assertion that "If its no Scottish, its CRAP!!!"
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 500mL bottle.  Poured clear, brighter golden with a tight-bubbled off-white head.. set up nicely in the glass.  The aroma picked up some lovely bready malts accented by grassy, herbal, and slightly grainy hops.. balance was spot-on.. I really enjoyed it.  The flavor found semi-sweet bread and honeyed malts at the core, surrounded by lightly-bitter lemon rind and herbal hops.. finished with a kiss of lemon over honeyed malts.  Lighter-bodied with lively carbonation on the palate.. just enough tanginess/bitterness from the hops to keep it interesting.. really, really good stuff.
En gyllengul öl med ett vitt skum. Doft av säd, gräs tillsammans med citrus. En stram munkänsla med samma smaker som i doften. En beska som inte dominerar men harmonierar.
Kullan värinen olut melko niukalla valkoisella vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on sitruksista humalointia ja maltaisuutta. Maussa on keksiä, sitrusta, yrttejä ja rapeaa maltaisuutta.

super clear crew sporting light amber colour. bubbly brew. nice aroma considering i was expecting much more macro-lager notes. some hay/cereal but there is a nice floral note i cant place. palate is balanced, malted and slightly bitter.  very tasty lager!

500ml brown bottle. Clear golden pour, compact white head with minimal lacing. Nose is grainy, some mild citrus, grass and mild fruits. In the mouth - toasty up front, grain, citrusy and fruity middle, grassy end. Pleasant bitter fade. Good soft mouthfeel, easy drinker.

500ml bottle pours a pale golden orange color with a 2 finger white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass.  Aromas are grass and citrus with some cereal grains.  Taste is pleasant grassy and citrus hop bitterness with a nice grainy malty balance of sweetness.  One of the better lagers that I have ever tried.  A well crafted lager truly deserving of premium lager status.

500 ml bottle. Finland. HHOKXI.
Clear pale golden colour with small white head.
Fresh grassy and fruity hops in aroma. Hops slightly subdued. Some malt too. Flavour is very grainy malty (some Müsli too) and fresh fruity hops. Thin but very drinkable Lager.
Clear dark yellow body, white head. Aroma is fresh with green hops and grainy malt. Flavour is hard with grainy malts. When warms turns bit unpleasant and harsh bitter. Nice one.
Clear golden colour with minimal head. Was expecting more. Malty, bit hoppy. Good, but really pricy lager.
Bottle from Alko. Golden color, white head. Slightly bitter taste with plenty of malts and some citrus. Very decent lager.
Taste and aroma was malty with grassy hops. One of the better tasting and looking lagers ive had.

50cl bottle. Poured clear golden with a frothy, white head, nice lacing. Aroma is citrus hoppy fruity and maltiness. Flavor is citrus, hops, cookies and malt. Decent bitterness in the finish. Thin body, otherwise refreshing and nicely hopped.
Pours light golden with a frothy head. Aroma butter, grass, hey, bread. A better half of the lager genre.

A golden beer with a almost medium and white head. Aroma is fresh and nicely aromatic, fruitness, citrusfruity hoppyness and smooth malts. Taste is light malty and slightly biscuity, some fruits, almost medium, grassy hoppyness in the aftertaste. Medium- bodied, nice carbonation, smooth to drink. Nice, aromatic beer with enough of bitterness.

500 ml bottle. BBE 09/2013.
Pours agolden colour with a white lacy head. Aroma of sweet fruits and floral hops. Flavour of floral hops with some hop bite, sweet fruits and biscuity malts. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a bitter, malty and slightly fruity finish. Decent, could be more refreshing.
Pours clear golden with a high head. Aroma is fruits and malts. Flavor is grassy malts with some hops. Pretty nice lager.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks beerandbeyond.  Clear pale golden with bubbles. Crisp orange aroma and some malt. Tastes bitter and fruity, has some sweetness towards the end. Smooth, light body, lively carbonation. cool!
Clear golden yellow colour, thin white head. Aroma of citrus fruit, grassy hops and malt. The flavour is malty, citrus fruity, with a strong, dry, grassy hoppy finish. Tasty and refreshing.

Draft at In De Wildeman.  Clear gold pour with a medium white head.  Aroma of citrus, grass, fresh hops and floral aspects.  Strong citrus, grassy fresh flavour leading to a more subdued bitter finish with some spice.  Medium carbonation and above light body.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks beerandbeyond. Pleasant hoppy aroma with flowers, some grass and light graininess. Flavor has light malty bready sweetness and pleasant mild bitter floral hops.  Medium-bodied. A nice refreshing lager.

Bottle from Half Time. Pours light amber gold with a slight white head. Noble hop aroma - perhaps with a little breadiness. Med body. Flavor of pale malt and grassy/herby hop. Theres a fair amount of hop, but the breadiness acts as backbone. Comes across like a German pils? But hoppier than most. If the ABV was higher, this might be considered imperial. Finishes hoppy!

500ml bottle. Pours clear light amber with minimal white head that doesnt really last and has insanely airy bubbles. Pretty light nose. Apple juice and light cereal grain, maybe a hint of hops. More interesting on the palate with a nice cereal grain note, some good bitterness and a bit of a green feel as well. Interesting stuff.

Botella de 500ml. Saboreada en abr´12. Color dorado brillante. Apariencia cristalina. Corona blanca y túpida con bastante buena retención. Aroma de malta dulce con matices florales. Entrada fresca con malteado dulce. Los sabores quedan envueltos por un afrutado agridulce con un sutil toque picante. Lupulización evidente con notas cítricas. Paladar de agradable y limpio amargor. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación suave. Retrogusto lígeramente afrutado. Interesante selección de lúpulos: Challenger, Styrian Golding  y Hallertau Hersbrucker. Muy buena y placentera asimilación. Buen equilibrio de aromas y sabores. Un Lager elegante por encima de la media. Muy recomendable para una refrescante sesión de cañas.
500ml bottle. Lager glass. Enjoyed on apr´12. Bright golden color. Crystal clear appearance. White, dense, crown with fairly good retention. Sweet malt aroma, floral hints. Crisp upfront  & sweet  maltiness. Flavors involved by  sweet/sour fruitness & subtle puckering touch. Evident bitterness showing citric notes. Gentle clean bitter palate. Medium body, soft carbonation. Slightly fruity aftertaste. Interesting hop selection : Challenger, Styrian Golding & Hallertau Hersbrucker. Very pleasant drinkability. Well balanced flavors & aromas. An elegant lager above the regular average. Highly recommended as refreshing session beer.

The fourth beer in my random beer tasting evening on 12 Aug 2011. The 500ml brown bottle had almost 15 months life left, so it was fairly fresh when it got poured into two Veltins Pilsner badged stemmed tulip glasses.

A Scottish craft lager, it looked fine, like a golden clear lager/pilsner should, the thin pure white head also typical of the style.

The Hallertau Hersbrücker, Styrian Goldings and Challenger hops dont give off much aroma, nor does whatever lager malt and lager yeast are. There is a slight hoppy smell, but not much.

The taste however is certainly hoppy. Refreshing and clean tasting, with hints of grapefruit throughout.

Good body depth (for the style) and all in all a good friendly lager.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2014 Crystal clear golden colour. Pillowy soft medium fast fading head. On the nose aromas of floral hops, grass and a fresh spring breeze with hints of earthyness arise. The taste develops flavours of light bready malty sweetness at first which fades into a harmonic floral bitterness with a slender body and soft-slick texture. The finish offers a stronger bitterness which lasts a brief moment but is all well balanced.

(50 cl bottle from YNWA; BBD: January 2013) Pours a clear, straw golden with plenty of carbonation and a thick, white head with retention and lace. Aroma is grassy with notes of bready yeasty and something more fruity resembling lime. Medium carbonation, oily texture, full body with a bitter finish. Taste is moderately bitter with little sweetness.

Mooolto beverina! Sapori dolci del malto (insoliti per una lager!!!). Agrumata con flussi di pompelmo e lime. Finale leggermente amarognolo che concludono efficacemente questa birra. Leggermente , di poco,  superiore alla Bitter and Twisted a mio parere.  Ora gli inglesi mi ammazzeranno.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, grain, lager yeast, and some hops.  Poured yellow/gold in color with a small, white head that diminished but lasted throughout as a film on top of the beer and around the edges.  Clear.  Slightly sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet and medium bitter.  Tastes of malt, hops, lager yeast, and a hint of dirt.  Medium body.  Slick, then dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Lightly sweet, medium bitter, lager yeast, malt, and hop finish is dry.
Poured light reddish brown, aroma of grass and some mild peat or maybe Im being swayed.  Very good session lager

50 cl bottle @ Kultainen Apina. Rated on 27.04.2011
Aroma is rather hoppy with fruits, some grass and grain. Flavour is hoppy with fruits, grass and some grain. Rather nice lager with great balance.
Bottle. Looks like a shady lager but is a lot more. Yeasty alger notes with a citrus hoppyness. An excellent lager.

500ml bottle.  This beer has a fresh sweet smell and looks like your typical lager but on the palate is more ale like due to reduced carbonbation.  The taste is very refreshing with a distinct grapefruit note and hoppy backbone.  An excellent lager that tastes good and is highly sessionable at only 4.8%.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2013 Aroma is bread and hints of yeast and fruit.  The flavor is grains, citrus, yeast, fruit, and beery and mildly bitter finish.  Kind of understated in flavor but as a whole it was pretty decent.
Cerveja com um sabor bem interessante. Primeira sensação bem diferente do seco e raspante retrogosto. Não que isso seja ruim, mas sim interessante.

Cask.  Pours a clear yellow/gold with a thin off-white head; spare lacing.  Aroma is lemon, straw, and banana.  Flavor is citrus and earthy hops and straw.  Medium body with light carbonation and warmth.  Okay beer.

Tap.  Pours clear gold with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing.  Aroma is earthy and herbal hops, light malt with light fruity esters.  Flavor is malt with medium hops and bitterness, light esters and a dry finish.  Light body,warmth and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Golden bodied with a tall, fluffy white head. Aroma is big floral and herbal hops with citrus fruit, bread dough and grass. Taste has toffee, bread dough, lemon zest, grass, floral hops, grapefruit, soft pine, herbal hops, and buttery notes. Body is medium with a foamy, moderate carbonation. Finishes with more citrus fruit, floral hops, pine notes, buttered bread, grass and herbal hops.
Bottle. Looks like a lager. Doesnt taste conventionally of one though. Lovely bitterness, grapefruit. Well balanced and unconventional. Verry good.

Sparkling golden beer, nice off-white head.  Light nose that features fresh, moist fruit scents - grapefruit, melon. The taste is moderately bitter with hints of sweet shortbread. The palate is light, crisp, well-carbonated. This is a very nice lager.
Bottle 500ml at Tyndrum (Scotland). Great hop character. Aromas of grapefruit, hay, grass, and wet leaves. Taste is sweet and bitter. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Pale, with no head.

Bottle (500ml):
Clean smelling and light on the nose but with a little work I can detect some corn, bitter hops and a very faint amount of grain along with a biscuit like aroma at the end.

Orangey amber colour with a white, foamy head that is about a couple of millimetres thick.

Corn and some floral, grassy hops this time leading to a pretty crisp taste. It has very little grain, some biscuit like flavour and a light buttery sweet flavour towards the end.

Medium bodied and quite smooth on the palate with a nice crisp, refreshing finish. This one is a treat in this department and I cant really fault it too much; excellent especially for the style.

A pretty good craft lager and one of the nicest of the style that I have tried so far.

1001 Beers Blog:

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2012 Surprisingly good. Was expecting a standard lager/pils but this was a more complex and interesting experience. Pours a clear amber with nice cascading carbonation. Lots of fruity hops come through, but not really bitter. A well balanced and very refreshing beer. Not a traditional pilsner though.
Distinct citrusy, hoppy aroma. Very clean and refreshing taste with a sharp citrusy flavour. A very full finish dominated by floral hops.

Keg at the Queens Head, London (as well as bottle on various occasions). It pours golden yellow, with a thick white head. The nose is toasted malt, floral, light spice, grass and citrus. The taste is white bread, golden syrup, biscuit, floral, lemon, hay and grass, with a light citric-bitter finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. A flavoursome Scottish lager, spot on.

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, floral and herbs hops. Taste medium sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle.Pours clear golden with a white head.Aroma of citrus, cheesy hops, malt and fruitiness.Flavor is sweet and bitter with some spruce and citrus.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice hoppy lager.

50cl bottle @ Berts Bar, Edinburgh. Pours golden but hazy with steady carbonation. The nose has toffee, hay and a hint of lemon. The taste has a good tangy lemon note with cereal going on in the background. The palate is big for a lager, so medium bodied, the texture is also quite chunky for a lager and the finish is clean and refreshing. Overall, a classic Scottish take on lager!
Ljus gyllengul vätska med ganska lågt vitt skum. Doft av ljust bröd, säd, citron och besk humle. Frisk och lätt, rejäl maskrossbeska, lång eftersmak, ganska torr. Överraskande bra lager, bra balans.

Bottle @ Voldby beerfest. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of malt, citruss, grassy hops. Taste is malt, grape, citruss, grassy hops. Thin body, soft carbpnation, rather bitter finish. 270811
Bottle. Clear dark yellow with small white head. Flavour is malt, spices, hops, citrus and a little bitter.
(Bottle 27 /08 - 2011) low white head, clear yellow color, slightly hoppy aroma, some bitterness.
Bottle. Golden beer. Clean and crisp without much bitterness. A very approachable easy drinking lager.

Bottle from Dobbies, putting in a shift on the wedding invitation production line with Octo. Bright gold with a slim white cap and intricate lace. Nose lemon jelly, wine gums, gooseberry, peppery and wood sap notes. Unspoilt all round: a sniffer. Good thistle-like, gooseberry hop putting me in mind of Belgium; too fruity for a pils proper- Bel pils, maybe. Soft carbonation, pepper and pine, peat hints. Very little in the way of malt, but its there for body and feel. Enjoyable beer.
I really like this beer. I could drink this all night. it is  really clean crisp lager. it is only a pity that it isnt readily available in australia.

Bottle from Tesco
Appearance Light golden, clear, 3 finger frothy white head, good lacing.
Aroma Light malt, some light grassy and citrus hops.
Taste Straw malt, light grapefruit hops with a gentle bitter finish with some tart grapefruit.
Palate Fresh, crisp mouthfeel, light body. Carbonation bit more than average.
Overall Very good lager out of the fridge (16/20), when warms up more like a golden ale (14/20). I think its 70% golden ale, 30% lager. I wonder what this would be like from keg?

Unclear golden with white head. Aroma is "green"  with lots of fresh cut hay and grassy hops in the nose. Taste is light sweet with a light malty profile and a lively hop-presence with tones of grass, resin and pine in the mouth. Body is light, carb is soft, finish is bitter and dry.
Bottle. Medium gold with a thin white head. Aroma of citrus hops. Flavour is floral hops with a tangy sharp bitterness.
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is malty, fruity and light hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 260511

50cl bottle at the vlaamsche reus
Hazy blond colour. Thin wire head. Hoppy aftertaste

Bottle. Pours clear golden with nice white head. Beautiful aroma of crisp hops with delicate floral notes. Medium body and medium carbonation. Lovely tangy fruity (stone fruit and lychee perhaps?) refreshing start with long steadily evolving good bitter finish. An excellent beer.
bottle: Golden color, nice head. sweet aroma and a almost fruity taste. Dry and bitter hoppy finish.

From Cockney Pub, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled.
Golden with white head. Aroma of malt and spices. Flavor with some hay and lager sulphur
Bottle @ Henrik. Pours golden with some head that disappears fast. Hints of grapefruit and other citric fruits. Very drinkable and refreshing. A nice bitterness to it. One of my favorite lagers.

Bottle @ Biskopen, Bergen. Small white head resting shortly on top of a slightly hazy orange body. Nose is citrus, pale malts and hints of grapefruit. Taste proves to be slightly more lactic-tasting pale malts, fresh, grassy hops and hints of grapefruit again. Some earthy hints in the aftertaste, with a moderately bitter finish. A very nice pilsener of the more fruity variant from Harviestoun.

0.5l bottle @ Biskopen, Bergen. Pours a semi clear pale body with a almost non excising thin lacing head. Some fruity nose, and some thin faint hops. Medium-bodied with medium carbonation. Instant small bitter, citrus and malts. Hints of yeast and bitter grapefruit twist. Nice and mild lager. Read this was pronounced as the best lager in the world (on the bottle). Not so sure about that, but it was really not bad.
Golden ber with inviting hoppy aroma. Fruity and flinty in the mouth with good lasting hop flavour. Ive been drinking Harviestoun beers for years and am constantly impressed by their quality.

(bottle) pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of zesty citrus fruits and grapefruit pulp, with light notes of caramel and bread. flavour is mostly the same, very citric and hoppy, with hints of cactus juice and pears. medium body and carbonation with a fittingly bitter finish.
26th March 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Strong and bitter like a German lager but with noticeable citrus and an airy light palate.

The beer in glass is strong golden yellow with a flat, fine,
short-lived crown. The smell is towards aromahops. Here were Hersbrücker and Challenger used. The beer starts good hoppy spicy, similar to a good Pale Ale. The aftertaste is very
grainy, especially corn comes through very much. The
further course is very grapefruit-sour. The finish is slightly dry and tart, with very good hop aroma in the finish.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015 Bottle. Clear orange with a white head. Low bead. Aroma is mainly lemon, but theres oranges and a little clove as well. Taste has lots of citrus bitterness upfront, a tiny bit of light caramel, a little wheaty (?) sourness and a spicy bitter finish. Yes, dry and refreshing but not engaging. Unbalanced - the malt side is pretty vacant. Seems ashamed to be a lager. [2.9]  Bottle. Very clean but slightly bready malt, lots of lemon and light spices. Refreshing.
Gold colour, fresh citrus floral aroma with some sweetness. Not overpowering hops, zesty and citrus with a good malt base. Lingering bitter/citrus finish. Great value summer beer.

Bottled. A clear yellow golden beer with a creamy white head. Aroma is grassy and fresh, citrusy notes. Taste is Taste is malty and slightly fruity, citrusy notes. Very refreshing and drinkable. Soft carbonation

UPDATED: APR 6, 2012 Bottle from Tesco Extra. Corn, tropical & citrus fruit aroma. Rich golden amber colour, not much head.  Biscuit & citrus fruit flavour. Bitter aftertaste. More of a blonde ale than a lager.

(Bottle, Oliver Twist, Stockholm) Slightly hazy golden colour with lasting, white head. Fruity nose with floral hops, orange and mandarin. Fruity taste with notes of mandarin, peaches, lemon and floral hops. Medium body with a touch of sweetness and a slightly citrussy bitterness in the finish. Very refreshing and well balanced. Nice.
Gift from the Scotsman (Scott McCall) Golden/ yellow pour. Aroma of citrus, mild hop and fruit. Taste was malty and sweet with a bitter finish. It was ok.

Pours clear pale golden with huge fluffy white head. Sweet floral, fruity, a bit malty and hoppy aroma. Crispy sweetish and fruity flavor, very refreshing, with notes of malts and hops. Acidy crisp and still lean fruity on palate. Finishes with dry bitter and tart hoppy aftertaste.

Bottle at Cardinal. Pours hazy straw golden with a finger thich white head. Inviting malts and hops aroma. Medium sweetness and bitterness in good balance with spruce and fruity notes. Medium body. Dry palate. lots of flavor for a lager - thankfully the flavors are all good. This is a long time favorite, which I finally got rated.

This is a premium lager? errr no, as no premium lager tastes as fresh,zesty and colourful as this. Ahh if only a stella, becks or carlsberg had the fruitiness and body of this unfiltered beauty. Love this brewery!

Bottle. Pours a clear golden beer with a white head. The aroma is malt, notes of sourness and citrus. The flavor is malt and hops with citrus. The palate is fresh and a little bitter. Overall a beer just above average.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is malt, fresh citrus, floral hop and light apple. Flavour is malt, citrus and floral hop.
Slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Hoppy aroma with herbs, hay and citrus, along with bready malt. Dry herbal and citrus flavour with medium bitterness.

Bottle @ VV Odense tasting. Pours unclear yellow with a small white head and lacings. Nose is citrus hops and bready malts. Fresh and crisp flavor with citrus and grassy notes up front. Medium and smooth palate. Quaffable

Bottle.

A - Crisp, light gold with a slight orange hue. Thick, foamy white head with good retention and a fair amount of lacing left.

S - Full of hops smells. The more prominent being grapefruit and orange, but not far behind is a floral and a bit grassy smell. Very enticing and mouthwatering, really making me think its an IPA.

T - A lot of hop and bitter taste. Follows the nose, with citrus being the most prominent hop taste. Good amount of floral, tea and grassy hops as well. At the end of the sip, there is a bit of a malt finish along with some general bitterness.

M - Medium to light body with moderate carbonation and crisp.

D - Easy to drink and good flavors. Flavors dont kill the palate, and definitely build.

Notes: Hard to really decide what style this taste like, a lot like a lager and an IPA, but when talking about Euro Pale lagers, something like this definitely doesnt come to mind. Good hop flavors, and easy to drink. Easily recommended if you have a chance to get it.
Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Nice golden body. Hoppy and grapefruit nose. Really pleasant hoppy taste with nice grapefruit notes. Very nice for a lager. I quite like this one.

Bottle from Tesco, 2009-12-22, Uddingston
AR: IPA
AP: golden cristal clear + 1/2 cm diminishinh white head
F. IPA, medium + bitterness, hoppy, grapefruit. You can sense that this ale is well brewed story!

Bottle. Golden colour, large to moderate white head. Moderate carbonation. Aroma is initially surprisingly moderate but nice and pleasant, improves as the beer warms, flowery and citrussy hops, hints of honey too. Flavour is zesty and grapefruity, the hops dominate but there is also a sufficient malty base. Bitter aftertaste of grapefruit peel.
Thnx Bullit. Yellow colored brew. Flowery hops. Crisp, a bit sweet, nice bitterness. Very drinkable.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a white head that doesnt last long. Hoppy nose has notes of lemon, grapefruit, passionfruit, malt and pine. Flavour is also hoppy and is very similar to the aroma but with more tropical fruit and caramel. Medium bodied and very well balanced with a little bit of sweetness on the front palate and some mild bitterness lingering on the back. An excellent lager that is complex and straightforward at the same time.
Bottled. Clear yellow color, short head. Aroma of soft english hop, bit flowery. Decent bitter taste, bit crisp. Indeed very drinkable for a premium lager.
Bottled. Tnx Bullit.Aroma has fresh, flowery hops. Pale, yellow coloured beer with a thin, white head. The taste is bitter, qith crisp hops. Light bodied beer with a bitter dry end. Good.
Bottle from Sainsburys. Light golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus and malts.  Flavour has citrus, honey, malts. Fairly dry and bitter finish. Well drinkable.

A Mes rate: Bottle from Kris Wines, drunk at home.Was amazed to recently find Id not rated this. So I got some on the way home tonight and supped it while putting my rates in. Ive always enjoyed this and I still do. A really enjoyable clean British lager with a faintly German twist. Nice sharp hoppy bitterness, Nice yeasty hint and a good bit of biscuity malt. Does everything it should do and does it well.

500ml bottle. Amber honey gold colour with a thick white foam pillow. A little murky looking with a citrus and vanilla aroma. Light and dry in the mouth and on the palate with a crisp tart finish and grapefruit flavour.

50 cl bottle at Rotary Pub, Göteborg. On October 10, 2009
Hazy pale golden color, fluffy white head. Hoppy sweet scent. Dry and nutty taste. Medium 
mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

average frothy white head. fair lacing.mostly diminishing longevity. cloudy for a lager, average density and medium yellow body. aroma: moderate hoppy, herbs, apple and honey. if: light sweetness and moderate bitterness. ff: moderate bitterness. long duration. palate: light medium body, dry texture, lively carbonation and chalky finish. otimo amargor de lupulo, seca bastante a boca. É a lager mais seca que já provei. 45s

chiara buona schiuma media persitenza note mielose maltate lieve ma presente citriche lupplate leggero legno in bocca ruitorna il malto presente ma delicato buona secchezza note lupplate agrumate citriche un po di esteri forse

gialla paglierina,con una bella testa di schiuma,poco persistente.
