secondo me è una lager atipica,ma molto buona!
Bottle, straw colour with a white head. Aroma of malt and fruits. Great flavours of grapefruit and citrus. Really good lager.
Looks inviting in a tall glass; golden, good frothy head, nice big bubbles.  Sweet perfume and malt aroma.  Passionfruit and decent hop bitterness in the mouth.

50cl bottle from Tescos, Edinburgh. Typical lager look - straw body, white head fading to a ring, light carbonation; but not typical in all other respects; creamy aroma with citrus, grain and honey; explosive flavours with honeyed sweetness, grapefruit bitterness and a full body; dry bitter finish. An excellent example of how a lager should be made.

A clear yellow/golden beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma is malty with fruits like citrus and flowers. The taste is dry bitter, fruits like citrus. There are some hops. The aftertaste is dry bitter with a little sweet.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2013 Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm.
Pours clear and still with a white head.
So clean and drinkable, yet full of taste and a nice body. Could always have another one.

It poured a hazy golden liquid with a small but big bubbly foam that made it look very fresh. It had a strong smell of honey and hops, both flowery and grassy. The flavor was fresh with grassy hops and a hint of citrus. It was a bit watery but overall very nice, without a doubt one of the best lagers Ive tried.

Bottle. High creamy and lasting white head. Slightly hazy peach coloured body. Mild fruity aroma with a hint of heather. The hops bitterness is more present in the flavor than expected. Otherwise fruit and heather prevails. Low carbonation. Long bitter aftertaste.
50cl Bottle. Hazy gold color with a medium white head. Lot of hops in the aroma and some malty notes. Same flavor as aroma. Quite bitter and a very nice lager (ale) to enjoy at a hot summer day.

Bottle (500ml).  At The Rake, sneakily purchased by harrisoni, which person I owe several pints to, and counting.  Clear pale gold pour with an average white head.  Nice aroma - heather and grassy cat piss pungent bitterness (thats a good thing, BTW).  the taste follows - pungently bitter, underlying light floral sweetness.  Average body, decently crisp, a nice grassy linger - obviously a fresh bottle - I really like their bottled golden beers, when fresh.
17.05.2009, 0,5l Bottle. ABV 4,7%. Pale yellow colour with firm white head. Aroma dominated by aroma hops. grapefruit and spice maybe. Nice bitter aftertaste.

500 ml bottle @ Vastarannan kiiski, Helsinki. Golden color, frothy white head. Grassy hop aroma. Bitter, malty flavor with some grapefruit, fairly dry finish. Medium body, medium-high carbonation. Not my personal favorite, but not bad for the style.
Yellow colour and clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Nice spicy hoppy aroma, malty too. Flavor is mainly bitter. Dry texture.
...bottle.  Nice and clean, but thin and watery.  Good for a hot day, but nothing to kick youself in the balls about.

500ml bottle from First Choice liquor stores into a pilsner glass. A clear straw coloured lager with small white head. Aroma of sweet fruity malts. Feels smoother than your average mass produced lager with a tastes of grainy honey malts. The advertised grapefruit taste occurs later with a crisp dry hop bitterness in the finish. Sessionable and refreshing.

Bottle that Im unsure where it came from but I would imagine a certain Mr Garvieuk would be the most likely person to put this my way in a Cropredy box. Pours hazy golden with a thin white head, nice malty aroma and there is a really nice streaky citrussyness about this predominantly lemon and grapefruit. Well impressed with this it finishes with a really nice lingering bitterness, very decent. A6 A3 F7 P4 OV14 3.5

An unexpected treat from a country where quality lagers are few and far between. The Harviestoun range ranks among the best in Scotland, so I was delighted to find it in Australian bottle shops - and at prices that compare favourably with those in its homeland. This situation is too good to last, so I have loaded up while I can. Schiehallion is a hazy gold with hits of tangerine and a lasting head. There are nice lifted tropical fruit notes in the aroma - lychee, canned peaches, plus fresh hay and uncooked dough. The palate is much softer than commercial lagers, and all the better for it. This is lip-smacking good, zesty and as refreshing as a walk in the Scottish mountains. Decent grapefruit bitterness, lychee again and a satisfying buzz in the finish. Very sessionable. I could drink a lot of this over summer. [500ml bottle from Vintage Cellars, Clovelly. BB July 09 2009]
Bottle 0,5ltr: Scottish lager brewed in the best Czechs way. Golden coloured with a grassy/fruity taste and a well sweet bitter finish.

500 ml bottle. Label says 4.7% abv, possibly watered down for the Norwegian market (or more likely relabelled). Golden colour. Clear. Medium-sized white fluffy head that clings to the glass. Rich malty aroma with lots of earthy and floral hops. Spicy hoppy flavours with a rich maltiness. Oily texture with a sharp cutting hop bitterness. Very refreshing. Reminds me more of an ale than a lager, but thats likely because there is a lot of things happening in the beer, much unlike most other lagers. Crisp hop bitterness in the finish. A really nice flavourful beer. The perfect session beer.
Nice golden colored, small white head, which disappear rapidly. Fresh fruity aroma. Hoppy to start with, light malt , turn sweet in the end, a good lager
Clear golden with tiny white head. Sweet fruity aroma with floral hops. Sweet flavour with floral hops and citric notes.

Bottled(500ml). -Yellow golden coloured, medium sized white head, fresh grapefruity nose. Light malty, herbal hoppy and fruity lemony taste with obvious notes of grapefruit. Bitter finish, quite odd but pleasant beer.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with ogivlado (thanks!) Golden body, a bit fizzy, with a medium sized thick white head that wasn’t quick to get away. The nose is light, hoppy, but very pleasant and grapefruity. Wow, the commercial description was correct. The taste was similar, chewy grapefruity hop covering an elusive, quite light sweetish maltiness underneath. Definitely atypical for this style but oh so pleasant.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2013 Draught @ OT. Pours golden, slightly hazy, with a small white head. Notes of grape, orange cest, and flour in aroma. Taste has got light citrus notes and also notes of orange cest, yeast, caramel and washing detergent. Lime in aftertaste. Soft creamy body, yet big bodied for a lager. Ridicilously quaffable.

Pale golden colored. An OK head that settled in a few minutes. Fruity aroma with grapefruit dominating. Pleasant flavor dominated by lemon and grapefruit - rapidly followed by a dry lasting finish. Some sourish bitterness. A very good lager.

500ml bottle. Clean, bright gold body, with moderate sized white foam, leaving lace. Lemon citrus on the nose, some leafy and earthy spice hop presence in there with a hint of a grainy malt background. Body reasonably lean, medium carbonation, a clean, zesty bitterness makes itself apparent quite early on. Excellent hop presence on the body, the aforementioned Challenger hops certainly stamp their character on the body; leafy, earthy spice (vanilla?) with a marmalade bitter lemon/orange, very nice, with a reasonably modest hint of maltiness to back it all up. Finish is dry but very clean and refreshing. A fantastic lager from a country that one would associate more with ale. Highly recommended!

Bottle (in NZ), pours a clear gold with a pure white foamy head. A very strong and clean citrus hop aroma. Some creamhy malt on the palate, with only moderately bitter flowery and fruity hops in a finish that was a bit weak. A lager I would drink though.
Lager look with a tightly beaded head.  Tastes of citrus and salt.  The salt is huge and flattening on the tongue.  Lots of grip and chewiness.  Good beer.

Botella. Pours a clear sparkling golden colour with a medium white ehad. Fresh hoppy bitter aroma. Good mouthfeel. The flavour is mildly fruity with a good bitter hoppiness and some malt. Dry bitter crisp finish.

Bottle, courtesy of norwegian importer.
Pours clear golden with small white head. Wonderful fruity hop aromas (EKG?) and super-refreshing taste. Perhaps the best lager I’ve tasted.
Bottle at ÅBF08. Fruity aroma. Clear golden colour. Good bitterness in flavour, also nice and fruity. Bitterness gets rough, but is cleansing.
Bottle at parent’s. caramel, spruce, golden, clear, aminimal head, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, average carbonation,

Almost clear, pale, lemon yellow body with short head. Some grapefruit on the aroma as well as some floury notes. Taste is light, almost crisp, citrus shows again although not too much. Overall it is different from other premium lagers perhaps better than most but not that interesting to excite me a great deal.
Malt hop aroma with sweet malt aftertaste finish. Murky yellow colour with slight brown and poor head and lacing. Malt hop flavour with fruit. Flat palate.

Århus2008 50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a lacing white head. Light hops fruity aroma. Flavour holds a nice citrusy fruity hops note. Light bitter yet with a persisting fruity finish.

Bottle. Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, fruity, moderate hoppy, grape - flower. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, and a dry fresh finish. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. (250308)
Golden with a moderate head. Big hoppy aroma of orange, grape and flowers going into nice citric flavours balanced by caramel malts. A very fine lager!

Bottle: A bit unclear, greenish-golden coloured, smaller but lacy creamy white head; distinctive aromatic floral and lemony hops in the nose, backed by some pale malt; solid bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied, soft MF; long and longer dryish citrousy and pale malty finish. Beautiful aromatic Lager..........

(bottle) Unclear, greenish golden colour with a short foamy white head. Light-sweet, aromatic fruity (citrus) and slightly woody hoppy nose with a moderate malty sweetness in the background. Bitter flavour, light bodied with a soft and mellow mouthfeel. Soft malty base with aromatic hops from the beginning; very dry and quite bitter hoppy finish, almost lingering with woody and light fruity notes. Very aromatic and pleasant brew (19.03.08).

500ml bottle (4.7%) picked up at Centra, Colosseum, Oslo (bb. April 08).Almost clear golden body colour supplied by a thin, but lasting white head. Smell of light grassy hops on a malty backbone. Flavour is a mixed bag of dry hoppy fruits - grapefruits, apricots and oranges - entwined with rather tangy malts. Medium bodied and flat carbonation. I wish they could make lagers like this in Norway (on a Friday eve, 22.02.2008).
Thin head,fair carbon,colour is is yellow.Aroma mild citric and some sweetness.Flavour grapefruit,tangy, it has a crispness, plus a maltiness at the finish with a bite on the tongue,bitter perfect.

Nose of honey, grass and soft hops. Colour is a bold golden colour with a white head. Soft mouth feel, citrus, grapefruit and malty taste. Very hoppy and spicy in the finish. Delightful lager, one of the best Ive ever had - perhaps only the Paulaner is as good. Brilliant.
Thanks Dave! Golden of color with a white head. An aroma of lemongrass and bread. A flavor of malt, citrus and grass.

Scotland 2005. This lager has a beautiful golden color and a nice head. The aroma has floral notes of hops. The flavour also have rather strong floral notes of hops and a nice, dry and bitter finish. It has a good body, and is quite nice.

Bottled (thanks cgarvieuk). Yellowish golden colour, not much head. Aroma is leather, fruity hoppy and also has some grass and wood in it. Flavour is really fruity with some grassy and flowery hints. Refreshing and fruity.

Bottled
Golden color, small white head. Fruity (juicy lemon) aroma. Very fruity for British beer, fruity hops and sweetish citrus dominate the flavor. Late bitterness in the aftertaste. Tasty lager, more like an ale!
Bottle. Pours gold with foamy white head. Aroma is light and floral / fruity. Taste is grassy / sweet with bitter dryish finish. Not bad at all.
Thanks to Joebrew and Chris0 for sharing.  Pale yellow color.  Some hops and grain in the nose and body but not much else going on.

Bottle from Peckhams, Glasgow.  Gold with thick white head.  Without doubt the best cask conditioned lager in Britain.  Even in a pasteurised bottle it is superb.  The crispness of the Hersbrucker hops is good, slightly leafy.  Lovely creamy hoppy herby aroma.  Actually excellent.  Bit of yeast on aroma, wheat gives it a wide mouthfeel.

Joebrew shared this at his Sunday BBQ via compliments of ChrisO when he visited the RBSG 07. Pours a semi-clear golden blonde brew with a thin white head that has quickly dissolves to a white ring and spotty lacing. Aroma of a light pilsener style beer, some light bready malt, citrus zest with some lemon. Taste is light to medium bodied, light carbonation with a light crisp bready malt flavor. Finish is light crisp and nearly clean with a mild bitterness. Pretty simple beer to me.
A tasty lager, I thought it was a bitter.  Low carbonation and considerable malt as well as a lightly bitter flavor.  There is a hint of lemon in the aroma, and a bitter finish.

Shared at Joebrews BBQ; courtesy of JK (and I believe ChrisO originally brought it over here).  Gold color with no head.  Slight aroma of sweet grains.  Ditto on the flavor.  Light floral and Earthy hops.  Very nice and simple lager.
500ml bottle. Golden body with a dense white head. Hoppy, fruity, bitter aroma. Flavor is fruity, citrus, sweet malty and well balanced bitterness. Nice, tasteful and refreshing beer.
This is a nice beer with somewhat complex flavors including bread, hay, light nutmeg, mild orange peel and a somewhat floral finish.  I liked it and would drink it again.

(50cl bottle) Clear straw body with small white head.  Aroma is mild, medium sweet, grassy, light lager yeast.  Taste is medium sweet, grassy, some earthy, lemon/lager yeast sour, light biscuit.  Smooth light body.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2009 50 cl bottle - 4,7% (Norwegian version). Hazy golden color, white head. Hoppy aroma. Flavor is sweet with good hops, some fruit. Bitter, dry aftertaste.
Bottle - Beautiful proud golden colour with a crisp and fruity aroma.  Wonderful fruity/bitter taste with a lasting finish, a truely outstanding beer

Pale and refreshing. Wonderful hoppy aroma, reminds me of well made hoppy lighy lagers, probably because of the hersbrucker. Well balanced, honey-taste and lightly grainy. Impressive for being a processed bottled beer of 4,8%.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is pale golden. Aroma nice and hoppy. Taste is hops with nice bitter finish.
Nice clean golden colour, with a hoppy aroma and a full sharp fruityness with a little hop bitter

500 ml bottle. Yellow golden with a slight haze. Small white head. Alluring citrus and flowery hop aroma. Mild fruity-sweet taste. Gentle hops in the background. Soft mouthfeel. Long, dry and hoppy finish. Highly refreshing. Filed as a "Premium Lager" (?) Ok for me, Ive got myself a new Premium Lager fav!

Clear golden with a fine creamy and staying head. Very nice flowery hoppy aroma.. Low carbonation. A touch watery. Begins sweet and ends with a lot of hops - not that bitter though - but a more flowery feel.

Big white creamy head over clear golden body. Clear, golden deep hop aroma of tropical flowers, fruit, metal, and a touch of smoke. Taste is again flowers and fruit with lots more of the smoke. Quite bitter. Dry, hoppy, metallic aftertaste. Very nice! (0.5l bottle.)

Clear golden with a medium sized white head. Strong aroma of grapefruit, yeast, pine, citrus, magnificent! Flavour is also very hop driven, with grapefruit and other citrus. The malts are not as solid, with only some simple caramel flavours coming through. Great hoppy, crisp finish. A great beer, would love to try it from the pump.
Wonderful hoppy kick - creates a full grassy aroma that belies its low alcohol content. Wonderful!
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is hop, fruit, sweet, malt. Flavour is sweet, hop, fruit. Light bitter finish.
Creamy white excellent mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and very good hoppy aroma. Fantastic flavor, average finish. Nice bitter. Creamy palate. Excellent premium lager.
Pale golden colour with a large white head. Malty, fruity aroma with a hoppy citric note. Hoppy fruity flavor with a dry and citric finish.
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a big white head. Malty, flowery, fruity, hoppy aroma and taste, sweet. Medium body with a light dry finish.

Bottle.
Clear yellow with a white head.
Aroma of fruits, grape fruits and grass.
Flavour of fruits, grape fruits, grass and hops.
Im not really a lager drinker, but this is an excellent example. Very well made and how (in my opinion) a lager should be.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2006 Tasted 05/03/2006.  500ml bottle from Rumbles, Wellington.
Pours a very pale straw-gold, almost green-hued, that hints of wheat malt.  Thin white head diminishes quickly but leaves a thick lacing.  Lines of tiny effervescent tiny bubbles trail up the side of the glass.  First sniff reveals a minerally lager yeast.  The nose then opens up into a lovely hop dominated bouquet of passionfruit and lychees, with a faint, underlying, grainy sweetness.  Mildly sweet lager malt hits the mouth first and lingers all the way through.  Its followed closely by more of the hop hits - more tropical fruit, with a citrus edge, and a cedary bitterness through the middle to the clean finish.  Some slight yeasty notes near the end are the only negative but these are very faint.  Medium weight and carbonation lead to a slightly creamy mouthfeel.  Superb balance.  This lager is right up there with Emersons Pilsner.  Id certainly love to try it on cask.

Clear golden colour with a white head. Floral hop aroma with hints of honey. Flavor is grassy with citrus, a little graprfruit aswell. Long bitter aftertaste.

Golden colour with a modest white head. Nice citric hop aroma, but also some sweet maltiness underneath. UPDATED: AUG 23, 2006 Not best aroma or appearance, but refreshing and flavorful on a hot day. Fizzy.  Clean.  Golden.

Bottled, pasteurised, 500ml. Gold coloured with fizzed head. Sharp citrus flavours, lemon, grapefruit with a strange touch of tannin. Smooth underlying malt and some hop on the finish but largely forgettable.

500 ml bottle, now available in Norway. ABV here is 4.7%. Golden colour, large to moderate white head. Moderate carbonation. Aroma is initially surprisingly moderate but nice and pleasant, improves as the beer warms up a little (started drinking it too cold), flowery and citrussy hops (Hersbrücker and Challenger), hints of honey too. Flavour is zesty and grapefruity, the hops dominate but there is also a sufficient malty base. Bitter aftertaste of grapefruit peel. A very unusual lager, clearly related to its golden ale cousin, the Bitter & Twisted.
Grapefruit!!! Pours a nice golden colour.Aroma is hoppy grapefruit. Taste is like a beered grapefruit juice very nice, excellent beer here maybe better than cask.
PREFERED BITTER AND TWISTED FROM SAME BREWER..MORE BALANCED THAN THIS, IT WAS OKAY...ALL I CAN SAY.

These guys really know what theyre doing!  Bright golden pour with big, long-lasting, rocky off-white head.  Wonderfully aromatic: fruity (citrus mainly) especially grapefruit! Great creamy-smooth  mouthfeel, almost like a cream ale!  really very fresh tasting, right out of the bottle, yet.  Front-heavy hop bitterness, both floral and grapefruit (Challenger).  I LOVE this beer...great session beer!  My one regret: I neglected to save some for my buddy Cornfield...just wasnt thinking (or expecting something so great!)

Harviestoun really do know how to make tasty bottled beers.  Really drinkable and moreish.  Could drink a sessionful of this.  Score 3.7Subsequent rating scored 3.6  Score unaltered
From A Bottle.Bright gold in colour with a medium head,aroma is sweet and fruity,taste is of summer with some nice citric fruit.

Woderful golden colour with a fine, frothy head that left good lacing. Aroma was of sweet honey. Citric sourness in the taste and a medium bitter finish. My opinion of Scottish beers continues to rise.
